bioghist.p: Clifford Manshardt (1897-1989) was the editor of The Mahatma and The Missionary, and the founder and for many years director of the Tata School of Social Work in Bombay.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of an undated and unbound typescript of "When Religion Divides: The Story of India and Pakistan" by Clifford Manshardt and two bound volumes of "Transition: The Shipmans of Bombay, 1839-1947" by Manshardt, a fictionalized history of British involvement in India.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
